CAKEFEST

The tri-state area's only rhyme-mandatory, all-cake music festival.
Founded by Dinsworth, a DB-4000 doorbell with generalized anxiety disorder.

14,207 Tickets Sold
38.7 Tons of Cake
247 Dinsworth's Panic Attacks (This Week)
3 Rhyme Violations (Pending Trial)
"Come one, come all, the stage is set to bake,
Every mic and monitor? Entirely made of cake.
I'm Dinsworth. I'm a doorbell. Please don't ring me twice.
I organized this festival. My therapist said it's nice."

The Lineup

"Every name upon this list was chosen with great care ‚Äî / if their music doesn't slap, I'll ring myself (don't dare)."

FRI 7:00 PM
DJ Ding-Dong
Dinsworth's cousin. Makes beats entirely from doorbell samples. Will cry if you boo.
Red Velvet
FRI 9:30 PM
The Flour Girls
All-cake punk trio. Instruments are cake. Smash them mid-set. Crowd goes feral.
Devil's Food
SAT 3:00 PM
Lil' Spatula
Mumble rap but every lyric rhymes with "frosting." Impressively, it works.
Carrot Cake
SAT 8:00 PM
Chime & The Doorbells
Dinsworth's therapy group turned band. Their hit single "Don't Ring Me" charted at #47 in Latvia.
German Choc.
FRI 6:00 PM
MC Batter
Freestyles exclusively in couplets. Has never broken a rhyme scheme. Legally cannot.
Marble Cake
SAT 5:00 PM
Anxiety! At The Disco
Dinsworth's personal playlist brought to life by session musicians who also have anxiety.
Angel Food
SAT 10:00 PM
The Bundt Punks
Hardcore. Bundt cake mosh pit. Signed a waiver? Good, you'll need it.
Bundt (obv.)
SUN 4:00 PM
Crumbella
Ethereal folk. Voice like buttercream. Her guitar is cake. She eats it during the bridge.
Lemon Drizzle
FRI 8:00 PM
Ring Ring (CANCELLED)
Dinsworth booked them before realizing the name. Panic attack lasted 4 hours. Refunds pending.
N/A (Trauma)
SAT 2:00 PM
YEAST MODE
Technically bread, not cake. Legal team is "looking into it." Plays hard anyway.
Contested
SAT 9:00 PM
Sponge Theory
Experimental ambient. 40 minutes of a cake absorbing syrup, mic'd. Transcendent, honestly.
Tres Leches
SUN 6:00 PM
Dinsworth (Solo Set)
Just Dinsworth ringing himself rhythmically while crying. Last year it got a standing ovation.
Emotional
⚠ REMINDER: Any artist who fails to rhyme on stage will be escorted out by our Fondant Security Team and fined $312.50.

Frequently Asked Questions

Disclaimers, Legal Notices & Apologies

1 CAKEFEST is not responsible for structural cake failure, emotional cake dependence, or accidental doorbell-ringing trauma.
2 Dinsworth is a registered DB-4000 doorbell (serial #DB4K-2019-0847). He is not a licensed event coordinator. He is trying.
3 The phrase "everything is cake" is meant literally. If you find something that is not cake, please report it to the Cake Integrity Hotline: 1-800-ALL-CAKE.
4 Rhyme violations are prosecuted under the CAKEFEST Municipal Rhyme Code (est. 2024). Ignorance of the rhyme is no excuse for the crime.
5 93% of attendees report "moderate to severe" cake saturation by Day 2. This is by design.
6 The Fondant Security Team are former pastry chefs with Krav Maga training. Do not test them.
7 Dinsworth's anxiety is real and documented. Please do not ring, ding, chime, buzz, or knock near him without written consent from Dr. Chime.
8 YEAST MODE's classification as "cake" is under active litigation. CAKEFEST takes no position but privately thinks they're bread.
9 The Emotional Support Surcharge ($2.00) directly funds Dinsworth's bi-weekly sessions with Dr. Chime. It used to be $1.50 but "things escalated."
10 No doorbells were harmed in the making of this festival. One was emotionally strained. He consented (in writing, notarized by a cake notary).
